page.title: 20RECREATION FETE TUNSTALL
page.content: The Tunstall summer fete is an annual event.It is held in June or July in the school grounds and on the lawn of the oast house.There are lots of stalls and all the money raised goes either to the primary school fund or towards restoring the parish church.In past years the fete has raised between four and five hundred pounds.Some stalls require a degree of skill such as throwing golf balls into numbered tubes;the highest score of the day being the winner.This stall was called "Down the Drain".A number of raffles are also organised and it is possible to win anything from food and drink to teddy bears.The Westlands School Band plays for most of the day,and Fourth Year pupils from Tunstall Primary School perform dances round the maypole.
